pull_request.title: API update for subdir support
pull_request.body:
With a plugin installed that contains subdirectories (like fpp-ArtNetAdv)
There is an error opening /api/files/plugins
In /opt/fpp/www/common.php on line 1409 AND sizeHuman is shown as 0.00B

In common.php, function human_filesize used du -k which can return multiple lines of output when subdirectories are present
Switched to du -bs to return one human readable file size (or directory total size) in bytes
Added some additional logic to keep the size formatting the same

Attempting to use /api/file/:DirName/:FileName GET for a file in a subdirectory failed
Updated to /api/file/:DirName/** to support subdirectories
Modified GetFile to use the ** value as the fileName
Did a grep for usage in FPP and it appears everything still works as expected
Updated endpoints.js

issue.title: Schedules using even/odd days not displaying in preview past 30 days into the future
issue.body:
**NOTE:** IF YOU DO NOT ATTACH YOUR LOG FILES, THEN THERE IS A HIGHER PROBABILITY THE ISSUE WON'T BE RESOLVED.  (Steps at end) 
# Please answer the following:
**FPP Version and Hardware**: 
FPP 6.3.2 and 7.2.2 running on RPi 3B+


**Describe the bug and Steps to reproduce**: 
1. In advanced system settings, set Scheduler max timeframe to schedule out to 3 months
2. Create a test schedule with Start Date = today's date, End date to defualt 2028-12-31, Days to Even or Odd
3. Start time 3pm to stop 4pm, some test playlist, loop immediately (these don't seem to matter)
4. Save the new schedule, reload schedules then open the preview.
5. Even/odd day schedules stop showing in the preview past about 30 days or so into the future from the current date.

**Expected behavior**: 
Preview should show even/odd day schedules out to Jan 2024 because of the 3 month scheduler max timeframe set.

**Additional context**: 
All other days settings in the scheduler seem to work OK and the preview correctly shows them scheduled out to Jan 2024. I do not know if this is just a previewer issue or they really are not scheduled properly, I first found this on FPP 6.3.2 then tried 7.2.2 to see if it still exists. Had no issues with even/odd scheduling last year using FPP 5.5.

If I try a future state date for the odd/even schedule, like Nov. 23, 2023 (Thanksgiving eveniing) then nothing shows up in the preview and it says nothing is scheduled.

**Additional Attachments**
7.2.2 logs attached.

If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
Screen shots attached.
[FPP_Logs_20231022.0022.zip](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/files/13062115/FPP_Logs_20231022.0022.zip)
![Everyday Preview correct](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/acb3945a-e2d3-4e46-b775-c853721ac291)
![Everyday Schedule](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/aca4d1bb-4d97-46d0-b5ff-b2cc62b91249)
![Odd Preview](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/92bf8038-4c25-4e7a-a36a-68d779c31d86)
![Odd Schedule](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/1a1fb59e-ab2b-4bd0-a1d7-0f9f3c60a438)
![Even Preview](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/8c63f88e-0733-484f-a253-07f80dbbf6c8)
![Even Schedule](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/31b89b85-684f-47cb-bdfd-9e32cc1ba5d4)
![Advanced Settings](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/8a2ff358-9dfd-42ed-8494-4f670d4265a5)
![2023-09-23 (8)](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/2b9baf39-18f5-4230-8ede-c773bcac134c)
![Future Start Error](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/49353358-5717-432d-82f1-cbea8e66e457)

issue.title: Schedules using even/odd days not displaying in preview past 30 days into the future
issue.body:
**NOTE:** IF YOU DO NOT ATTACH YOUR LOG FILES, THEN THERE IS A HIGHER PROBABILITY THE ISSUE WON'T BE RESOLVED.  (Steps at end) 
# Please answer the following:
**FPP Version and Hardware**: 
FPP 6.3.2 and 7.2.2 running on RPi 3B+


**Describe the bug and Steps to reproduce**: 
1. In advanced system settings, set Scheduler max timeframe to schedule out to 3 months
2. Create a test schedule with Start Date = today's date, End date to defualt 2028-12-31, Days to Even or Odd
3. Start time 3pm to stop 4pm, some test playlist, loop immediately (these don't seem to matter)
4. Save the new schedule, reload schedules then open the preview.
5. Even/odd day schedules stop showing in the preview past about 30 days or so into the future from the current date.

**Expected behavior**: 
Preview should show even/odd day schedules out to Jan 2024 because of the 3 month scheduler max timeframe set.

**Additional context**: 
All other days settings in the scheduler seem to work OK and the preview correctly shows them scheduled out to Jan 2024. I do not know if this is just a previewer issue or they really are not scheduled properly, I first found this on FPP 6.3.2 then tried 7.2.2 to see if it still exists. Had no issues with even/odd scheduling last year using FPP 5.5.

If I try a future state date for the odd/even schedule, like Nov. 23, 2023 (Thanksgiving eveniing) then nothing shows up in the preview and it says nothing is scheduled.

**Additional Attachments**
7.2.2 logs attached.

If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
Screen shots attached.
[FPP_Logs_20231022.0022.zip](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/files/13062115/FPP_Logs_20231022.0022.zip)
![Everyday Preview correct](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/acb3945a-e2d3-4e46-b775-c853721ac291)
![Everyday Schedule](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/aca4d1bb-4d97-46d0-b5ff-b2cc62b91249)
![Odd Preview](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/92bf8038-4c25-4e7a-a36a-68d779c31d86)
![Odd Schedule](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/1a1fb59e-ab2b-4bd0-a1d7-0f9f3c60a438)
![Even Preview](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/8c63f88e-0733-484f-a253-07f80dbbf6c8)
![Even Schedule](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/31b89b85-684f-47cb-bdfd-9e32cc1ba5d4)
![Advanced Settings](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/8a2ff358-9dfd-42ed-8494-4f670d4265a5)
![2023-09-23 (8)](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/2b9baf39-18f5-4230-8ede-c773bcac134c)
![Future Start Error](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/49353358-5717-432d-82f1-cbea8e66e457)

comment.body: This was just a preview issue, the preview for Odd/Even was previously fixed at 35 days.  I think that limit existed before we bumped up the preview to allow looking out longer distances into the future in another part of the code.  It is fixed in the master branch now.

commits.message:
Fix long-distance preview of Odd/Even schedule entries.

Preview for Odd/Even schedule entries was previously set at 35
days max instead of honoring the Max setting.

Fixes #1616

issue.title: Schedules using even/odd days not displaying in preview past 30 days into the future
issue.body:
**NOTE:** IF YOU DO NOT ATTACH YOUR LOG FILES, THEN THERE IS A HIGHER PROBABILITY THE ISSUE WON'T BE RESOLVED.  (Steps at end) 
# Please answer the following:
**FPP Version and Hardware**: 
FPP 6.3.2 and 7.2.2 running on RPi 3B+


**Describe the bug and Steps to reproduce**: 
1. In advanced system settings, set Scheduler max timeframe to schedule out to 3 months
2. Create a test schedule with Start Date = today's date, End date to defualt 2028-12-31, Days to Even or Odd
3. Start time 3pm to stop 4pm, some test playlist, loop immediately (these don't seem to matter)
4. Save the new schedule, reload schedules then open the preview.
5. Even day schedules stop at Nov 18 and odd ones stop at Nov 19 2023.

**Expected behavior**: 
Preview should show even/odd day schedules out to Jan 2024 because of the 3 month scheduler max timeframe set.

**Additional context**: 
All other days settings in the scheduler seem to work OK and the preview correctly shows them scheduled out to Jan 2024. I do not know if this is just a previewer issue or they really are not scheduled properly, I first found this on FPP 6.3.2 then tried 7.2.2 to see if it still exists. Had no issues with even/odd scheduling last year using FPP 5.5.

If I try a future state date for the odd/even schedule, like Nov. 23, 2023 (Thanksgiving eveniing) then nothing shows up in the preview and it says nothing is scheduled.

**Additional Attachments**
7.2.2 logs attached.

If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
Screen shots attached.

comment.body: After watching this for a few days, it seems to be just a preview issue. Even/odd schedules stop showing in preview after 30 days or so into the future from the current date. While all other schedule types display for the full max schedule time set in advanced settings.

issue.title: Playing MP4 Videos on a Raspberry Pi Zero 2 Crashes FPP after a few minutes, requires hard reboot to start again.
issue.body:
**FPP Version and Hardware**:  FPP 7.2 running on a Raspberry Pi Zero 2 with a USB Sound Card

**Describe the bug and Steps to reproduce**: 
A clear and concise description of what the bug is and the steps to be taken to reproduce. 
1. Fresh install of FPP 7.2 on a Raspberry Pi Zero 2
2. Upload several MP4 Video Files. In this case I was using files from AtmosFX designed for pumpkin projection. (Jack-o-Lantern Jamboree)
3. Create a playlist of several different MP4 files.
4. Manually start the playlist with the 'Repeat' option selected.
5. After a few minutes of repeating files, the audio cuts out but the video continues to play.
6. The video ends on the last frame of the video.
7. Logging in to FPP shows that FPPD has crashed. Clicking Start FPPD or Restart FPPD  does not work in this case and the only way to start FPPD again is to reboot from the web interface or a hard reboot by cutting power.

**Expected behavior**: 
The playlist will continue to cycle through the MP4 files without issue.

**Additional context**: 
Attached are log files that were written during the crash. The audio cut out at around timing 19:13:35 in the log file. Date: 10-20-2023. This was confirmed by using 2 separate Raspberry Pi Zero 2's with the same result. This is with a brand new fresh install of FPP 7.2 on a new SD Card.

**Additional Attachments**
Attached is a full log in 'Excessive' mode while completing the steps above.

[FPP_Logs_20231020.2315 (1).zip](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/files/13110575/FPP_Logs_20231020.2315.1.zip)

comment.body:
Here's an update since I was messing around with this all day.

I replaced the Pi Zero 2 with a full size Raspberry Pi 3+ and moved the Micro SD card from the Zero to the Pi 3 with no changes. The Playlist has been playing nonstop for about 7 hours now with no issues!

comment.body:
> There was a discussion on Sunday in the zoom room where a user with a Pi4 was playing videos in repeat mode and Not within a playlist, after finishing the video once and starting it over a Crash Log was created. Myself and others with PI4's were able to duplicate it with the users video's. Here is the users crash log
> 
> [fpp-Pi-7.2-2023-10-22_10-45-53.zip](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/files/13113939/fpp-Pi-7.2-2023-10-22_10-45-53.zip)

I also encountered this issue when getting this project setup. I would just play a video from the main status page and click repeat. After it ended, a crash log was generated. I got around that issue by making a playlist of 2 videos and having the playlist repeat. Since I was able to get around that, I figured this was a separate issue.

issue.title: Playing MP4 Videos on a Raspberry Pi Zero 2 Crashes FPP after a few minutes, requires hard reboot to start again.
issue.body:
**FPP Version and Hardware**:  FPP 7.2 running on a Raspberry Pi Zero 2 with a USB Sound Card

**Describe the bug and Steps to reproduce**: 
A clear and concise description of what the bug is and the steps to be taken to reproduce. 
1. Fresh install of FPP 7.2 on a Raspberry Pi Zero 2
2. Upload several MP4 Video Files. In this case I was using files from AtmosFX designed for pumpkin projection. (Jack-o-Lantern Jamboree)
3. Create a playlist of several different MP4 files.
4. Manually start the playlist with the 'Repeat' option selected.
5. After a few minutes of repeating files, the audio cuts out but the video continues to play.
6. The video ends on the last frame of the video.
7. Logging in to FPP shows that FPPD has crashed. Clicking Start FPPD or Restart FPPD  does not work in this case and the only way to start FPPD again is to reboot from the web interface or a hard reboot by cutting power.

**Expected behavior**: 
The playlist will continue to cycle through the MP4 files without issue.

**Additional context**: 
Attached are log files that were written during the crash. The audio cut out at around timing 19:13:35 in the log file. Date: 10-20-2023. This was confirmed by using 2 separate Raspberry Pi Zero 2's with the same result. This is with a brand new fresh install of FPP 7.2 on a new SD Card.

**Additional Attachments**
Attached is a full log in 'Excessive' mode while completing the steps above.

[FPP_Logs_20231020.2315 (1).zip](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/files/13110575/FPP_Logs_20231020.2315.1.zip)

comment.body:
> In the /boot/config.txt, near the bottom, there is a section where we set the gpu memory for each pi. Can you try adding:
> 
> `[pi02] gpu_mem=128`
> 
> and then rebooting and see if that fixes it?

Added the line to config.txt, rebooted and tried again - same result. The audio crash seems to be around 09:03:50 in this recent round of logs.

[FPP_Logs_20231024.1306.zip](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/files/13114945/FPP_Logs_20231024.1306.zip)

[FPP_Logs_20231020.2315 (1).zip](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/files/13110575/FPP_Logs_20231020.2315.1.zip)

comment.body:
In the /boot/config.txt, near the bottom, there is a section where we set the gpu memory for each pi.   Can you try adding:

`
[pi02]
gpu_mem=128
`

and then rebooting and see if that fixes it?

issue.title: Playing MP4 Videos on a Raspberry Pi Zero 2 Crashes FPP after a few minutes, requires hard reboot to start again.
issue.body:
**FPP Version and Hardware**:  FPP 7.2 running on a Raspberry Pi Zero 2 with a USB Sound Card

**Describe the bug and Steps to reproduce**: 
A clear and concise description of what the bug is and the steps to be taken to reproduce. 
1. Fresh install of FPP 7.2 on a Raspberry Pi Zero 2
2. Upload several MP4 Video Files. In this case I was using files from AtmosFX designed for pumpkin projection. (Jack-o-Lantern Jamboree)
3. Create a playlist of several different MP4 files.
4. Manually start the playlist with the 'Repeat' option selected.
5. After a few minutes of repeating files, the audio cuts out but the video continues to play.
6. The video ends on the last frame of the video.
7. Logging in to FPP shows that FPPD has crashed. Clicking Start FPPD or Restart FPPD  does not work in this case and the only way to start FPPD again is to reboot from the web interface or a hard reboot by cutting power.

**Expected behavior**: 
The playlist will continue to cycle through the MP4 files without issue.

**Additional context**: 
Attached are log files that were written during the crash. The audio cut out at around timing 19:13:35 in the log file. Date: 10-20-2023. This was confirmed by using 2 separate Raspberry Pi Zero 2's with the same result. This is with a brand new fresh install of FPP 7.2 on a new SD Card.

**Additional Attachments**
Attached is a full log in 'Excessive' mode while completing the steps above.

[FPP_Logs_20231020.2315 (1).zip](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/files/13110575/FPP_Logs_20231020.2315.1.zip)

commits.message: Don't keep eeprom mounted as a file to prevent any overwriting of the file

issue.title: Extract Audio Button
issue.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
A button on the Videos tab labeled "Extract Audio".  This button is very similar to the mp3gain button but instead it will extract the audio from the video and place it in the Audio folder.

The appropriate tool, ffmpeg, is already built into FPP so no other utilities need to be installed.  The syntax for ffmpeg to do this is below.

`ffmpeg -i INPUT_FILE OUTPUT_FILE.mp3` 

The above is reasonable defaults but the audio will always be re-encoded.  The various Pi & BBB based boards can handle this task without issue.

Possible enhancements to the above could be below but it's really not needed
* Logic to detect if the source codec is already mp3 and if so put `-c copy` between the INPUT_FILE and OUTPUT_FILE and nothing will be re-encoded and only file io is used.
  * Another option is to try to do the `-c copy` option first and check the exit code of ffmpeg.  If it fails then run the convert method.
* Option to run mp3gain after extraction

Note, I already tried to write the feature myself but did not have success.  I modified upload.php in /opt/fpp/www duplicating the mp3gain stuff in the Videos section, duplicating the function and duplicated run_mp3gain.php.    After adding this section none of the files would show up in the File Manager

``` php
<? if (file_exists("/bin/ffmpeg") || file_exists("/usr/bin/ffmpeg") || file_exists("/opt/homebrew/bin/ffmpeg") || file_exists("/usr/local/bin/ffmpeg")) { ?>
    <input onclick="ButtonHandler('Videos', 'extractAudio');" id="btnExtractAudio" class="disableButtons singleVideosButton multiVideosButton" type="button"  value="Extract Audio" />
<? } ?>
```

comment.body:
IMO: These types of changes ( conversion and maybe mp3gain ) need to get processed/updated in xLights or the files will just get overwritten on the next FPP connect.

If we are using this as a tool just to do the conversion then just have the resulting file download to the PC for the user to decide how to implement the new file as the sequences need to be updated to point to the mp3 for this to really work correctly.
potentially append _AUDIO_ONLY or something to the file name.

issue.title: Extract Audio Button
issue.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
A button on the Videos tab labeled "Extract Audio".  This button is very similar to the mp3gain button but instead it will extract the audio from the video and place it in the Audio folder.

The appropriate tool, ffmpeg, is already built into FPP so no other utilities need to be installed.  The syntax for ffmpeg to do this is below.

`ffmpeg -i INPUT_FILE OUTPUT_FILE.mp3` 

The above is reasonable defaults but the audio will always be re-encoded.  The various Pi & BBB based boards can handle this task without issue.

Possible enhancements to the above could be below but it's really not needed
* Logic to detect if the source codec is already mp3 and if so put `-c copy` between the INPUT_FILE and OUTPUT_FILE and nothing will be re-encoded and only file io is used.
  * Another option is to try to do the `-c copy` option first and check the exit code of ffmpeg.  If it fails then run the convert method.
* Option to run mp3gain after extraction

Note, I already tried to write the feature myself but did not have success.  I modified upload.php in /opt/fpp/www duplicating the mp3gain stuff in the Videos section, duplicating the function and duplicated run_mp3gain.php.    After adding this section none of the files would show up in the File Manager

``` php
<? if (file_exists("/bin/ffmpeg") || file_exists("/usr/bin/ffmpeg") || file_exists("/opt/homebrew/bin/ffmpeg") || file_exists("/usr/local/bin/ffmpeg")) { ?>
    <input onclick="ButtonHandler('Videos', 'extractAudio');" id="btnExtractAudio" class="disableButtons singleVideosButton multiVideosButton" type="button"  value="Extract Audio" />
<? } ?>
```

comment.body:
I agree that this can cause some confusion.  I think there are options

- Don't implement this
- Add logic that will delete the source file upon successful return code.  This will need to be displayed on the screen and fully automatic. 

Regarding the 2nd option above,  I'm not a fan of keeping both files as clicking the button and accepting the pop-up implies that they don't want the video file.  If they do want it then they can upload it again with ffp connect or manual and then go delete the audio file.

issue.title: Extract Audio Button
issue.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
A button on the Videos tab labeled "Extract Audio".  This button is very similar to the mp3gain button but instead it will extract the audio from the video and place it in the Audio folder.

The appropriate tool, ffmpeg, is already built into FPP so no other utilities need to be installed.  The syntax for ffmpeg to do this is below.

`ffmpeg -i INPUT_FILE OUTPUT_FILE.mp3` 

The above is reasonable defaults but the audio will always be re-encoded.  The various Pi & BBB based boards can handle this task without issue.

Possible enhancements to the above could be below but it's really not needed
* Logic to detect if the source codec is already mp3 and if so put `-c copy` between the INPUT_FILE and OUTPUT_FILE and nothing will be re-encoded and only file io is used.
  * Another option is to try to do the `-c copy` option first and check the exit code of ffmpeg.  If it fails then run the convert method.
* Option to run mp3gain after extraction

Note, I already tried to write the feature myself but did not have success.  I modified upload.php in /opt/fpp/www duplicating the mp3gain stuff in the Videos section, duplicating the function and duplicated run_mp3gain.php.    After adding this section none of the files would show up in the File Manager

``` php
<? if (file_exists("/bin/ffmpeg") || file_exists("/usr/bin/ffmpeg") || file_exists("/opt/homebrew/bin/ffmpeg") || file_exists("/usr/local/bin/ffmpeg")) { ?>
    <input onclick="ButtonHandler('Videos', 'extractAudio');" id="btnExtractAudio" class="disableButtons singleVideosButton multiVideosButton" type="button"  value="Extract Audio" />
<? } ?>
```

comment.body: I wonder if this would do more harm than good?  Eg if you had the video file, then pressed this button, you'd also end up with the audio file and and then fpp has to guess which one you want to play?

issue.title: Schedules using even/odd days not displaying in preview past Nov 19, 2023
issue.body:
**NOTE:** IF YOU DO NOT ATTACH YOUR LOG FILES, THEN THERE IS A HIGHER PROBABILITY THE ISSUE WON'T BE RESOLVED.  (Steps at end) 
# Please answer the following:
**FPP Version and Hardware**: 
FPP 6.3.2 and 7.2.2 running on RPi 3B+


**Describe the bug and Steps to reproduce**: 
1. In advanced system settings, set Scheduler max timeframe to schedule out to 3 months
2. Create a test schedule with Start Date = today's date, End date to defualt 2028-12-31, Days to Even or Odd
3. Start time 3pm to stop 4pm, some test playlist, loop immediately (these don't seem to matter)
4. Save the new schedule, reload schedules then open the preview.
5. Even day schedules stop at Nov 18 and odd ones stop at Nov 19 2023.

**Expected behavior**: 
Preview should show even/odd day schedules out to Jan 2024 because of the 3 month scheduler max timeframe set.

**Additional context**: 
All other days settings in the scheduler seem to work OK and the preview correctly shows them scheduled out to Jan 2024. I do not know if this is just a previewer issue or they really are not scheduled properly, I first found this on FPP 6.3.2 then tried 7.2.2 to see if it still exists. Had no issues with even/odd scheduling last year using FPP 5.5.

If I try a future state date for the odd/even schedule, like Nov. 23, 2023 (Thanksgiving eveniing) then nothing shows up in the preview and it says nothing is scheduled.

**Additional Attachments**
7.2.2 logs attached.

If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
Screen shots attached.
[FPP_Logs_20231022.0022.zip](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/files/13062115/FPP_Logs_20231022.0022.zip)
![Everyday Preview correct](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/acb3945a-e2d3-4e46-b775-c853721ac291)
![Everyday Schedule](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/aca4d1bb-4d97-46d0-b5ff-b2cc62b91249)
![Odd Preview](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/92bf8038-4c25-4e7a-a36a-68d779c31d86)
![Odd Schedule](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/1a1fb59e-ab2b-4bd0-a1d7-0f9f3c60a438)
![Even Preview](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/8c63f88e-0733-484f-a253-07f80dbbf6c8)
![Even Schedule](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/31b89b85-684f-47cb-bdfd-9e32cc1ba5d4)
![Advanced Settings](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/8a2ff358-9dfd-42ed-8494-4f670d4265a5)
![2023-09-23 (8)](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/2b9baf39-18f5-4230-8ede-c773bcac134c)
![Future Start Error](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/assets/9982279/49353358-5717-432d-82f1-cbea8e66e457)

comment.body: Some additional info: I did a test first with two schedules, Even days starting today running Playlist_A from 6pm to 8pm, Odd days starting today running Playlist_B from 6pm to 8pm. I see Playlist A & B alternating everyday as expected, but both stop on Nov18 (even) and Nov 19 (odd) in the preview. Same as I got yesterday. Then I added a third schedule starting today set to everyday running Playlist_C from 5pm to 6pm. The preview does expand to the full 3 months, but looking carefully, Playlist A & B still stop on Nov 18/19. Playlist_C continues on by itself for the rest of the preview out to 3 months. I have not found a combination yet where odd/even schedules run past Nov 19. At least not shown in the preview.

issue.title: FPPD 7.2 crashing in BBBPru constructor
issue.body:
**NOTE:** IF YOU DO NOT ATTACH YOUR LOG FILES, THEN THERE IS A HIGHER PROBABILITY THE ISSUE WON'T BE RESOLVED.  (Steps at end) 
# Please answer the following:
**FPP Version and Hardware**: 
FPP 7.2 running on a K16B 


**Describe the bug and Steps to reproduce**: 
1. Upload from XLights
2. Occasionally experience FPPD crash

**Expected behavior**: 
No crash

**Additional context**: 
N/A

Crash report from logs:
```
#0  __libc_do_syscall () at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/arm/libc-do-syscall.S:46
#1  0xb6660ee4 in __GI___wait4 (pid=13208, stat_loc=0xbebd6978, options=0, usage=0x0) at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/wait4.c:27
#2  0x004f883e in handleCrash(int) ()
#3  <signal handler called>
#4  memset () at ../sysdeps/arm/memset.S:46
#5  0xb69ebd7e in BBBPru::BBBPru(int, bool, bool) () from /opt/fpp/src/libfpp.so
#6  0xad5f1c0e in BBB48StringOutput::StartPRU(bool) () from /opt/fpp/src/libfpp-co-BBB48String.so
#7  0xad5f5ce6 in BBB48StringOutput::Init(Json::Value) () from /opt/fpp/src/libfpp-co-BBB48String.so
#8  0xb69f0792 in InitializeChannelOutputs() () from /opt/fpp/src/libfpp.so
#9  0x004f577c in main ()
```

[FPP Tree Crash Log fpp-BBB-7.2-2023-10-19_18-11-44.zip](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/files/13059276/FPP.Tree.Crash.Log.fpp-BBB-7.2-2023-10-19_18-11-44.zip)
